intro: Senecio espinosae, commonly known as the Spiny Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, spiny leaves that help reduce water loss, and its yellow flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. Senecio espinosae is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
